alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 8:03PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wichita and Greeley Counties through 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/... At 703 PM MDT/803 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Kendall, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia, Marienthal and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
